intro: Dorotheanthus martini, commonly known as the golden groundcherry, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its low-growing habit and yellow-orange flowers. The plant produces small, edible fruits that resemble cherry tomatoes, often referred to as "groundcherries." Its foliage is typically hairy, and it thrives in well-drained soil with full sun exposure. Dorotheanthus martini is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its vibrant blooms and unique fruiting habit.
